chapter.title: &gnome; Videos
chapter.para: &gnome; Videos is the default movie player. &gnome; Videos provides the following multimedia features:

listitem.para: Support for a variety of video and audio files
A variety of zoom levels and aspect ratios, and a full screen view
Seek and volume controls
Playlists
Complete keyboard navigation

chapter.para: To start &gnome; Videos, click Applications Sound & Video Videos .

sect1.title: Using &gnome; Videos
sect1.para: When you start &gnome; Videos, the following window is displayed.

sect2.title: Opening a Video or Audio File

step.para: Select the files you want to open, then click Add

sect2.para: You can also drag a file from another application (such as a file manager) to the &gnome; Videos window. &gnome; Videos opens the file and plays the movie or song. &gnome; Videos displays the title of the movie or song beneath the display area and in the titlebar of the window.

note.title: Unrecognized File Format
note.para: If you try to open a file format that &gnome; Videos does not recognize, the application displays an error message and recommends a suitable codec.

sect2.para: You can double-click a video or audio file in &nautilus; to open it in the &gnome; Videos window by default.

sect2.title: Opening a Video or Audio File By URI Location

step.para: Specify the URI location of the file you want to open, then click Open.

sect2.title: Playing a DVD, VCD, or CD
sect2.para: To play a DVD, VCD, or CD, insert the disc in the optical device of your computer, then click Movie Play Disc .
To eject a DVD, VCD, or CD, click Movie Eject .

To pause a movie or song that is playing, click the &gnome; Videos Pause
button, or click Movie Play/Pause . When you pause a movie or song, the statusbar displays Paused and the time elapsed on the current movie or song.

To resume playing a movie or song, click the &gnome; Videos Play
button, or click Movie Play/Pause.
To play or pause a movie, you can also press P.

To view properties of a movie or song, click View Sidebar to make the sidebar appear. The dialog contains the title, artist, year, and duration of movie or song, video dimensions, codec, frame rate, and the audio bit rate.

sect2.title: Seeking Through Movies or Songs
sect2.para: To seek through movies or songs, use any of the following methods:

listitem.para: Click Go Skip Forward . Alternatively, use .
Click Go Skip Backward . Alternatively, use .

varlistentry.term: To move to next movie or song

listitem.para:
Click Go Next Chapter/Movie , or click the
&gnome; Videos Next
button.

varlistentry.term: To move to previous movie or song

listitem.para:
Click Go Previous Chapter/Movie , or click the &gnome; Videos Previous
button.

sect2.title: Changing the Zoom Factor
sect2.para: To change the zoom factor of the display area, use any of the following methods:

varlistentry.term: To zoom to full screen mode

listitem.para: Click View Fullscreen . Alternatively, press F.
To exit fullscreen mode, click Leave Fullscreen or press .

varlistentry.term: To zoom to half size (50%) of the original movie or visualization

listitem.para: Click View Fit Window to Movie Resize 1:2 .

varlistentry.term: To zoom to size (100%) of the original movie or visualization

listitem.para: Click View Fit Window to Movie Resize 1:1 .

varlistentry.term: To zoom to double size (200%) of the original movie or visualization

listitem.para: Click View Fit Window to Movie Resize 2:1 .

sect2.para: To switch between different aspect ratios, click View Aspect Ratio .
The default aspect ratio is Auto.

sect2.title: Showing or Hiding Controls
sect2.para: To hide the window controls of &gnome; Videos, click View Show Controls and deselect the option. To show the controls on the &gnome; Videos window, right-click the window, then select Show Controls. If the Show Controls option is selected, &gnome; Videos shows the menubar, time elapsed slider, seek control buttons, volume slider, and statusbar on the window. If the Show Controls option is not selected, the application hides these controls and shows only the display area.

sect2.title: Managing Playlists
sect2.para: To show the playlist, click View Sidebar . The Playlist sidebar is displayed.
You can use the Playlist dialog to do the following:

formalpara.title: To add a track or movie:
formalpara.para: Click the Add button. Select the file you want to add to the playlist, then click OK.

formalpara.title: To remove a track or movie:
formalpara.para: Select the file names from the file name list box, then click Remove.

formalpara.title: To save a playlist to file:
formalpara.para: Click the Save Playlist button, then specify a file name.

formalpara.title: To move a track or movie up the playlist:
formalpara.para: Select the file name from the file name list box, then click the Move Up button.

formalpara.title: To move a track or movie down the playlist:
formalpara.para: Select the file name from the file name list box, then click the Move Down button.

sect2.para: To hide the playlist, click View Sidebar , or click the Sidebar button.
To enable or disable repeat mode, click Edit Repeat Mode . To enable or disable shuffle mode, click Edit Shuffle Mode .

sect2.title: Choosing Subtitles
sect2.para: To choose the language of the subtitles, click View Subtitles Select Text Subtitles , then select the subtitles language (DVD) or subtitle file (AVI etc.) you want to display.
To disable the display of subtitles, click View Subtitles None .
By default, &gnome; Videos chooses the same language for the subtitles that you use on your computer.

&gnome; Videos automatically loads and displays subtitles if the file that contains them has the same name as the video file. It supports the following subtitle file extensions: srt, asc, txt, sub, smi, or ssa.

sect1.title: Modifying &gnome; Videos Preferences
sect1.para: To modify &gnome; Videos preferences, click VideosPreferences.

sect2.title: General Preferences
sect2.para: The General Preferences let you select a network connection speed, specify if media files should be played from the last used position, and change the font and encoding used to display subtitles.
General Preferences include the following:

listitem.para: Lets you specify whether to start playing the movie from the last position.
Select network connection speed from the Connection speed drop-down box.
Lets you specify whether to load the subtitles automatically, and change the font and encoding used to display the subtitles.

sect2.title: Display Preferences
sect2.para: The Display Preferences let you choose to automatically resize the window when a new video is loaded, change the color balance, and configure visual effects when an audio file is played.
Display Preferences include the following:

varlistentry.term: Automatically resize the window when a new video is loaded

listitem.para: Select this option if you want &gnome; Videos to automatically resize the window when a new video is loaded.

varlistentry.term: Disable the screen saver when playing video or audio

listitem.para: Select this option if you want &gnome; Videos to automatically disable the desktop screen saver while an audio file is playing.
You can choose to show visual effects when an audio file is playing, select the type of visualization you want to show, and the visualization size.
Specify the level of color brightness, contrast, saturation, and hue.

sect2.title: Audio Preferences
sect2.para: The Audio Preferences dialog lets you select the audio output type.
